content.user_title: Convert HTML prototypes to production React components
content.value_statement: Manually converting design prototypes to React components is time-consuming and error-prone. This skill automates the entire workflow from HTML analysis through component scaffolding to quality validation, reducing implementation time by 70% while enforcing consistent code standards.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes HTML prototypes and extracts component structure, CSS classes, and interactive elements
Maps HTML elements to shadcn/ui components with glassmorphism styling equivalents
Scaffolds TypeScript React component files from templates with proper imports and interfaces
Validates implemented components against quality standards (line limits, naming conventions, class validity)
Guides developers through 5-step workflow with interactive decision points
limitations: Requires pre-existing HTML prototype files in designated project directory
Target module structure must already exist in frontend/src/modules/
Glassmorphism CSS classes must be predefined in styles/glassmorphism.css
Does not generate HTML prototypes from design mockups

best_practices: Store HTML prototypes in .superdesign/design_iterations/ for consistent project structure
Run validation immediately after implementing component logic to catch issues early
Use the interactive mapping step to review and override suggested shadcn component mappings
anti_patterns: Skipping validation checks - they catch common issues before code review
Modifying scaffolded component structure without updating corresponding validation rules
Using custom glassmorphism classes not defined in styles/glassmorphism.css

faq.question: What HTML file formats are supported?
faq.answer: Standard HTML files with class attributes. Glassmorphism classes must follow naming conventions like glass-*, btn-*, neon-*.

faq.question: Can I customize the component templates?
faq.answer: Yes. Edit template files in templates/ directory. Templates use {{VARIABLE}} syntax for replacement.

faq.question: What quality standards are enforced?
faq.answer: Maximum 180 lines per file, I-prefix for interfaces, no 'any' types, valid glassmorphism classes, proper import patterns.

faq.question: Does this work with other UI libraries?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for shadcn/ui but mapping tables in SKILL.md can be extended for other component libraries.

faq.question: Where are generated components saved?
faq.answer: Components are scaffolded to frontend/src/modules/<module-name>/components/ directory structure.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple components at once?
faq.answer: Run the workflow for each HTML file individually. The skill maintains consistent structure across all components.
